item.title: Kristi add a quote by Peter Drucker
item.description: "There is nothing quite so useless, as doing with great efficiency, something that should not be done at all." -- Peter Drucker

item.title: Kristi add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Kristi add a quote by Martina Mcbride
item.description: "A statue stands in a shaded place An angel girl with an upturned face A name is written on a polished rock A broken heart that the world forgot" -- Martina Mcbride

item.title: Kristi add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kristi add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Kristi add a quote by Jonathan Edwards
item.description: "Resolved, that I will live so, as I shall wish I had done when I come to die." -- Jonathan Edwards
